intro: Lovanafia capuroniana, commonly known as the Capuron's lovage, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
